plugins.name: Copy & Rotate
plugins.description:
üîÑ‚ú® Create radial interfaces and patterns with rotated copies of elements.


Copy & Rotate harnesses the power of Figma components and creates instantiated copies can be modified after being created by the plugin.


In addition to changing the number of copies and radius of the rotation, individual copies can be skipped and the sweep angle can be adjusted.


‚ö†Ô∏è Caveats

  • If you want to copy & rotate multiple elements, group them first. Only one element must be selected.
  • It's not possible to rotate groups that contain component nodes. Remove the component or componentize the entire group first.
  • It's not possible to rotate elements that are children of components or instances. Select the parent instance or component element instead.


‚ùå Node types that are not supported

  • Document nodes
  • Page nodes
  • Slice nods

plugins.name: Animate Text
plugins.description:
Animate Text is a Figma plugin for creating highly customizable animated text, right inside Figma.


üöÄ What it does: This plugin works on text layers inside Figma. It can animate text by letters, words, lines, or paragraphs, and there are a lot of properties to play with. It also works on multiple text layers at once.


This plugin creates the animations using Figma‚Äôs components and variants, which makes the process fast and convenient (no need to leave Figma, and no need to save gifs/videos on the computer).


‚öôÔ∏è Additional capabilities:

  • Customize properties like direction, duration, delay, stagger, easing, offset, clipping, scale, etc.
  • Animate in, out, or in + out
  • Repeat animations


üìù Instructions: Using this plugin is a breeze! Just follow these simple steps:

  1. Select text layer(s)
  2. Run the plugin, and choose the animation type
  3. Customize the properties as per your liking, and click on the 'Animate' button!


üîó Additional Links/Resources:

  • Easing curves: easings.net
  • Create your own cubic bezier: cubic-bezier.com


Please note:

  • Animating text with emojis and lists might not work
  • When animating text with multiple lines, please ensure that you have added line breaks at the end of each line


ü§ù Reach out for support
plugins.tagline: Create stunning animated typography directly within Figma

plugins.name: Fignel - Convert Figma to Elementor
plugins.description:
Fignel is Live now!


Fignel Plugin Update: Fignel Plugin's Auto Layout Magic!

Now you only need to click one button to convert a design without auto layout to a design with auto layout!


Our Explainer Video

Welcome to Fignel.

Fignel helps you to convert your Figma design in to a live Elementor website just in a few clicks.


You can use Our Community File and Tutorial how to use, you can find there templates and guides on how to work with our plugin.

We always working on updates.


Simply use Auto Layout properties for your for your components and convert in one click to live Wordpress website.

You can convert a full page or single components with our plugin.


Exciting news for Fignel users!

We're rolling out a big update that includes several new widgets, including the Image Box, Icon Box, and Nav menu. But that's not all - we're also introducing ready-made templates that users can select straight from the plugin


Great news. AI here!

You now have the opportunity to work with AI to generate and edit your texts in the design. It is also possible to work with images using Chat GPT.


Effortlessly animate your website with Effects and Transformations. With just one click, apply stunning animations to any block on your webpage, creating a dynamic and immersive experience for your audience.


Widgets support:

  • Containers - Add word wrap to Frame name
  • Heading - Add to frame [H1 , H2 , H3, H4, H5, H6, div, p]
  • Text
  • Image - May take few moments when importing to Elementor
  • Vectors - Must be Grouped
  • Video - Paste any link from YouTube or somewhere else rename frame [link to video]
  • Button - [button]
  • Form - See example on community page
  • Icon Box
  • Image Box
  • Nav Menu
  • Gallery
  • Basic Gallery
  • Google Maps
  • Accordion

Sections and columns are not supported.


Feel free to contact us via Chat on website or email support@fignel.com

Try now our Trial version now!

Visit us fignel.com

plugins.name: Photoshop Importer
plugins.description:
‚ú® Import Adobe photoshop into Figma & FigJam.

Import your photoshop files (.psd) directly into Figma as pixel-perfect images.


ü™Ñ How to use:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Browse or drag-and-drop your photoshop file.
  3. Press the ‚Äúimport‚Äù button, and you‚Äôll have your photoshop file directly in Figma as a pixel-perfect image.


üß© Features:

  1. No monthly subscriptions‚Äîjust pay for what you use, when you use it.
  2. Limitless usage in Figma & FigJam.
  3. No registration required.


‚ùìFrequently asked questions:

What are import credits?

Import credits are units that users can purchase to import photoshop files. Each file consumes a certain number of credits based on the file size.


How are import credits calculated?

Import credits are calculated based on the size of the photoshop file you want to import. The bigger the file size is, the more credits it will consume.

Here's how it works:

  1. Files between 0 and 100 MB: 1 credit
  2. Files between 101 and 200 MB: 2 credits
  3. Files between 201 and 300 MB: 3 credits
  4. Maximum file size allowed: 300 MB (which requires 3 credits)

Note: Only successful imported files are counted.


Can I purchase multiple packages at the same time?

Yes, you can buy import credits in packages that suit your needs. We offer different options to accommodate various usage levels. You can find all available packages here.


How do I know how many import credits I need?

When you upload your photoshop file, we'll automatically calculate the required import credits based on the file size. You'll see this information before proceeding in the plugin‚Äôs UI.


What happens if I don't have enough credits?

If you attempt to import a photoshop file but you don't have enough credits, we will notify you and provide options to purchase additional credits in the plugin‚Äôs UI.


Are there any limitations on file size or number of imports?

The maximum file size allowed is 300 MB and there's no limit on the number of imports you can perform as long as you have sufficient credits.


Is there an expiry date or time limit on credits?

No, there is no expiry date or time limit on credits. You can use them whenever you need to import files without worrying about expiration.


Can I try the plugin for free?

Yes, we offer 2 free credits where you can try the plugin for free. This allows you to try and experience the functionality of the plugin risk-free.


üì© Feedback and support:

Your feedback is important to us! For comments, inquiries or assistance, please reach out to us at support@figmats.com


üí≠ Contact us:

Join our community for the latest updates, practical tutorial, future announcements and daily inspiration.

Website ¬∑ TikTok ¬∑ Facebook ¬∑ Instagram ¬∑ YouTube ¬∑ X (Formerly Twitter) ¬∑ LinkedIn

plugins.name: Variables Pro | Swap, Import & Export Variables
plugins.description:
See Videos OR Explore Playground File


ü•≥ We are working on next release which will be released in July 2025. Thanks


Description:

"Variables Pro" is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow by offering advanced variable management capabilities. With this plugin, you can easily swap variables between different collections, libraries, and local variables, making it a breeze to maintain consistency and efficiency in your Figma projects. You can also import and export variables with advance features.


Features:

  1. Swap variables: Let's you swap variables used in the current file. The source library is the one that has the variables you've already used in the current file. Swap those variables with the variables from the target library. You can select specific area / current page / all pages of a file for swap.
  2. Search and Select Specific Variables : Advanced search functionality allows you to find specific variables before initiating the swap, import and export operation. This feature ensures greater precision and control over the variable process.
  3. Import, Export Variables :  "Variables Pro" enable you to import and export variables seamlessly. Import and export supports variable with multiple mode, value as alias, scopes and code syntax. You can import and export variables in JSON format. You can select collections before export and import giving you the power of what you need.


Notes

Swapping Grid variables won't work in this case!

Here's the issue: If you apply a variable to one Grid type (e.g., COLUMN) and then switch to another type (e.g., GRID) on the same node, swapping the variable using the plugin will fail due to Figma API limitations.

Solution:

Clear conflicting variables: Clear any variables applied to other Grid types on the node.

Set the desired variable: Set the variable only in the Grid type you want to modify (e.g., size for GRID).

Swap variable (optional): If needed, you can then use the Swap feature.

By following these steps, you'll avoid errors and ensure successful management of Grid variables in Figma.


Swapping Effects variables : Layer blur and background blur variables is not yet supported due to the lack of from Figma API.

------------------------

Trial

For trial, you will get 10 attempts to try plugin features.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Pricing

License

You need to buy licence to use plugin. After installing "Variables Pro" plugin click on "Buy now" button and enter licence key received into email to activate it.

As passionate team at Figterate we are committed to bring new innovations for design & UX workflow to save time.

plugins.name: TextFlex
plugins.description:
Select a text element in your canvas, then use TextFlex to create a curved version of it. Modify the curvature interactively by resizing a plugin-provided guide circle to bend your text into any sort of circular or elliptical shape you like!


Instructions:

  1. With the plugin running, select an existing text element in your canvas.
  2. Press the "Add to Canvas" button to place a curved version of your text into the canvas. The plugin will also add a temporary gray guide circle next to it for modifying your text's curvature.
  3. Select the gray guide shape and resize it to change the curvature of your text. The text will re-bend itself around the guide shape as you change its height and width.
  4. Edit your original text (change color, font, size, etc.) to update your curved text.
  5. When you're finished, click away or close the plugin to clean up the temporary guide shape.


To edit a previously-placed text curve:

  1. With the plugin running, select a previously-placed text curve in your canvas. The plugin will add a temporary guide shape matching the curve of your text.
  2. Select the gray guide shape and resize it to see the text re-bend itself around your guide shape's new dimensions.
  3. Optionally use the plugin's buttons to change the positioning of the text around the guide shape.
  4. Edit your original text (change color, font, size, etc.) to update your curved text.
  5. When you're finished, click away or close the plugin to clean up the temporary guide shape.



This is a plugin for purchase, but it comes with a free watermarked demo version so you can try it out and see if it's what you're looking for.



While you're at it, if you liked this plugin, check out these other widgets I helped create as well!


DateStamp - Keep track of how your work evolves.


FigLabels - Keep track of your work's status.

accepted.name: Jon Lewis
accepted.description: üíª Software Engineer

plugins.name: Select Layers
plugins.description:
Select layers based on name, type, or similarity.


Fund my work on Figma plugins ‚Üí


Select Layers by Name

Selects layers that partially or exactly match the given name.


Select Layers by Type

Selects layers of a particular type:

  • Component
  • Variant
  • Instance Layer
  • Frame
  • Group
  • Slice
  • Vector Layer
  • Rectangle
  • Line
  • Ellipse
  • Polygon
  • Star
  • Boolean Group
  • Image
  • Text Layer


Select Mask Layers / Hidden Layers / Locked Layers / Layers With Exports

Selects layers with the specified attribute.


Select Parent Layers / Root Layers

Selects layers at the specified hierarchy.


Select Similar Layers

Selects layers with one or more attributes that are identical to the one currently-selected layer.


With the exception of Select Similar Layers, all commands make a sub-selection within the currently-selected layers, or creates a new selection of layers if the selection is empty.

plugins.name: AutoLayout
plugins.description:
AutoLayout dynamically lays out layers in frames and updates the layout when the dimensions of child layers change. It behaves similar to Framer Stacks and the Anima Toolkit for Sketch. 

Creating a simple list
1. Wrap the list elements in a frame
2. Open the Auto Layout plugin, select the frame and enable the toggle ‚ÄòLayout frame‚Äô
3. Change the direction to vertical and adjust spacing

How to create an auto-reflowing To Do list
1. Create a text layer and a rectangle as checkbox next to it for the first todo item.
2. Wrap both elements in a frame ( ‚åò + ‚å• + G )
3. Open AutoLayout and enable it for the frame. Set direction to horizontal and adjust padding/alignment to your liking. You can change the order by moving layers up and down in the layers sidebar. 
4. With the frame selected, set Height to ‚ÄòResize To Fit‚Äô in AutoLayout which will automatically resize the frame when the text field gets longer
5. Duplicate the frame a few times below to create a list of todos
6. Wrap all todo items in a frame and enable AutoLayout, set the direction to vertical. You can adjust spacing between the items.
7. Try adding a linebreak in one of the todo items to make it larger. The items below will automatically move down to make room.

The layout of the frame will update every second if either a child layer or the frame itself is selected. To update the layour, select a child layer or the frame while the plugin is open. 

AutoLayout is based on the Yoga implementation of Flexbox. Inspired by prior work from Scott Horsfall @scoh and Zachary Schiller @zacharyschiller

plugins.name: Proportional Scale
plugins.description:
Easily resize your shapes with all other attributes resizing proportionally. This plugin supports resizing by percentage, width or height.


Usage

1. Open any Figma file

2. Select a shape on your canvas.

3. Press `command + /` and search for 'Proportional Scale'

4. Run the plugin

5. `command + option + p` to re-run the plugin instantly


Roadmap:

  • Switch rounding of pixels on / off
  • Select which attributes to scale
  • Position multiple elements proportionately

  • Locked Proportions for Width and Height
  • Enhanced Precision

plugins.name: Variable Fonts
plugins.description:
Variable fonts, now in Figma!


A plugin to provide basic variable fonts support through samsa.js.


This plugin enables you to:

  • Render variable fonts as graphics on the Figma canvas
  • Preview, create, and edit/update these graphics
  • Choose from all the axes in a variable font
  • Choose from all the variable fonts available from Google Fonts


Usage


You should see the Variable Fonts palette appear, similar to the screenshot above.


  • Pick one of the dozens of variable fonts available from Google Fonts.
  • In the Preview section, enter some custom text.
  • Set the color and axes values you want.
  • Then click the Add button at the top of the Preview section.


This will add a Vector graphic object to your Figma canvas.


That result is a normal Figma Vector object that you can do all the normal things you can typically do with such objects.


It is NOT a Text object!


Do you have a bug, feature request, or improvement? Submit a PR or file an issue here: https://github.com/Tgemayel/variable-fonts-figma/issues

accepted.description: Growth @ Figma. I get buckets üèÄ

plugins.name: Give Me FigJam Connectors!
plugins.description:
Prefer to use those magic FigJam Connectors but feel tired of copying, pasting and dragging? Let this plugin do the work for you.


‚úÖ Enjoy every benefits from native connectors

‚úÖ Auto-connect elements based on relative position

‚úÖ Set up once and quickly use it anywhere in your file


üåà ·¥ò Ä·¥á·¥ò·¥Ä Ä·¥Ä·¥õ…™·¥è…¥ [!important]


  1. Select an existing native FigJam connector you copied from another file
  2. Use Plugin > Set to set it as your copy-paste source


üîó ·¥Ä·¥Ö·¥Ö …¥·¥Ä·¥õ…™·¥†·¥á ·¥Ñ·¥è…¥…¥·¥á·¥Ñ·¥õ·¥è Äs


Every time you hit Plugin > Add a Connector


  1. If nothing selected -> It'll create a new connector in your viewing area
  2. If exact 2 elements selected -> It'll connect them based on their relative position
  3. Nothing will happen for other cases


üí° …¥·¥è·¥õ·¥á


  1. Use ‚å•+‚åò+P to quickly execute Add a Connector again
  2. Every properties of the created connector will be the same as the one you set as the source (eg. set it 1px-dotted-yellow then you can quickly link your page flow under the same style)
  3. The source can be changed whenever you want (by executing Set), but it has to be keep in the file somewhere for the plugin function working


--

Native connector is currently not supported in Figma file, even its plugin API. The technique used here is just simple copy-and-paste. Hide your copy-paste source carefully (normally I put it inside my divider page üòå) in case it being unintentionally deleted by other collaborators.


Bugs / Improvements -> ‚úâÔ∏è khnkenny@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Use FigJam native connectors in Figma files

104624.name: Give Me FigJam Connectors!
104624.description:
Prefer to use those magic FigJam Connectors but feel tired of copying, pasting and dragging? Let this plugin do the work for you.


‚úÖ Enjoy every benefits from native connectors

‚úÖ Auto-connect elements based on relative position

‚úÖ Set up once and quickly use it anywhere in your file


üåà ·¥ò Ä·¥á·¥ò·¥Ä Ä·¥Ä·¥õ…™·¥è…¥ [!important]


  1. Select an existing native FigJam connector you copied from another file
  2. Use Plugin > Set to set it as your copy-paste source


üîó ·¥Ä·¥Ö·¥Ö …¥·¥Ä·¥õ…™·¥†·¥á ·¥Ñ·¥è…¥…¥·¥á·¥Ñ·¥õ·¥è Äs


Every time you hit Plugin > Add a Connector


  1. If nothing selected -> It'll create a new connector in your viewing area
  2. If exact 2 elements selected -> It'll connect them based on their relative position
  3. Nothing will happen for other cases


üí° …¥·¥è·¥õ·¥á


  1. Use ‚å•+‚åò+P to quickly execute Add a Connector again
  2. Every properties of the created connector will be the same as the one you set as the source (eg. set it 1px-dotted-yellow then you can quickly link your page flow under the same style)
  3. The source can be changed whenever you want (by executing Set), but it has to be keep in the file somewhere for the plugin function working


--

Native connector is currently not supported in Figma file, even its plugin API. The technique used here is just simple copy-and-paste. Hide your copy-paste source carefully (normally I put it inside my divider page üòå) in case it being unintentionally deleted by other collaborators.


Bugs / Improvements -> ‚úâÔ∏è khnkenny@gmail.com

plugins.name: Progressive Blur
plugins.description:
You no longer need this plugin ‚Äî progressive blur is now built into Figma!


https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041488473-Apply-effects-to-layers#background-blur


---


Add real progressive blurs to your files, all in Figma.


Usage

Add a progressive blur to the canvas, or apply it to an existing frame. The plugin remembers your blur radius, so if you want to change that, just open the plugin again.


If the effect isn't visible

Try increasing the default opacity in the plugin's settings tab.


Performance

Because there are many stacked blur layers under the hood, your file's performance might drop if there are multiple blurs on the page. I‚Äôd recommend adding them to a separate file or page, rasterize what you need, and bring the image back to your working file.


Special thanks to Silas for the CSS demo that inspired this.

plugins.name: Status Bar 1-click
plugins.description:
The Plugin inserts a Status Bar/Notification Bar at the top, and a Home Bar at the bottom.


You can use it for mobile screens, will not work correctly for tablet screens. (Check notes)


It has 3 icons - Wi-fi, Network and Battery.


Instructions

  • Select a frame/multiple frames
  • Run the Plugin!


Additional links/resources

  • How to use the Plugin? - YouTube Link


How to reach out and support

  • Just comment below


Notes

  • Works well with default Figma mobile frames (Android Large, iPhone 8 Plus, iPhone SE, iPhone 13 mini, iPhone 14 Plus, iPhone 13 & 14, iPhone 14 & 15 Pro, iPhone 14 & 15 Pro Max)
  • The Plugin makes sure that 'notification' and 'home bar' become Fixed Scroll, so they don‚Äôt scroll with parent in prototype.
  • Bottom and top bar are resizable, and the elements have accurate constraints
  • Bottom bar may not work correctly for custom screen sizes, and also for Android Small and iPhone 8.
  • Will be updating the plugin, this is an early release.

plugins.name: Logo & Illustration Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Create a logo or illustration in 30 seconds (using AI)!


This one is a bit different: sign up for an OpenAI API secret, and then use this Logo & Illustration Maker plugin to generate your own AI (and Dall-e 3) logos & illustrations. Just enter the name of your company or project, and a description of it, and this Figma Plugin will do it's best to generate a brand new logo or illustration for it. More details:


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. This is free to use. You just have to enter your own OpenAI API Secret (you can get one here: https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)
  2. By doing it this way, this plugin can remain free: you just pay directly for the OpenAI charges (it's around $0.04 each).
  3. All logos & illustrations generated by Dall-e can be used (so long as they don't infringe on any existing trademarks etc).
  4. These are AI generated logos & illutrations
  5. This Logo & Illustration Maker works best when you describe your brand


ü§î More:

  1. Track the history of all the logos & illustrations you generated, and quickly go back to them.
  2. Be descriptive: enter the style you're looking for and what your company or project does.


üõü Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is

plugins.name: Axure
plugins.description:
Easily copy frames from Figma to Axure RP or publish frames directly to Axure Cloud.


Copying frames from Figma to Axure RP lets you quickly bring your designs to life with the powerful prototyping capabilities of Axure RP. Simply select your frames in Figma and use this plugin to copy them. Then in Axure RP, paste your design onto the canvas. This feature requires Axure RP version 9.0.0.3743 or newer.


Learn more: Importing from Figma to Axure RP


Publishing Frames to Axure Cloud allows you to collaborate with your team, build basic prototypes, and seamlessly hand off visual assets and CSS to the development team. Now, you can keep your RP prototypes and Figma designs in one place! You‚Äôll need to install the Axure Cloud desktop app before using this feature.


Learn more: Publishing from Figma to Axure Cloud


Get In Touch

If you have any questions, bug reports or feature requests, feel free to contact us at support@axure.com.


Axure Forum

Join the Axure User Forum to get advice on how to prototype your perfect solution or to share your expertise with the community.

plugins.name: Screenshot2Design
plugins.description:
üëã Hello everyone

We are happy to announce several updates of Screenshot2Design plugin.

The usability is significantly optimized and some errors were fixed.


We are busy developing our AI model to replace the simple structure to a sophisticated AI model.

If you have any feedback or advice, we'd love to hear it through comments and via email!


(Last updated: UTC 14:56 on May 30, 2023)



Introducing S2D, the revolutionary AI design automation tool.

Our plugin converts screenshots into editable design files,

allowing you to reference work in a matter of seconds.

Try it out today and see the difference for yourself!


üí° With S2D, you can..

  • Automate Your Design: Empower screenshots to an editable design file automatically. Eliminate tedious tasks and focus on the essence!
  • Boost Productivity: Convert dozens of professional website references into fixable mock ups with ease. Click, convert, and save hours of time on design and iteration.
  • Enhance Designing Process: Elevate your design process with our AI-powered plugin to find the perfect look and feel for your project.
  • Prototype Super fast: Get inspiration from the most successful designs and tweak and examine them with ease.


‚ö†Ô∏è Things to remember

  • S2D only read the original image. S2D does not reflect changes made in Figma.
  • S2D supports maximum 10 images.
  • Each image size could be upto 10MB.


üó∫Ô∏è How it works

  1. Search Screenshot2Design Plugin from the Plugins menu.
  2. For the initial setup, fill in the form.
  3. Submit the API Key automatically copied to the field.
  4. Select a screenshot to convert.
  5. (optional) If you set your design information, conversion quality will get better.
  6. Run S2D Plugin, reference work in a matter of seconds!


üí∞ 100% Free

S2D Plugin is 100% free during beta launch. However, credits will be required after the official release.

Call to Action‚òéÔ∏è

For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI


Key Features:

1. Prompt-to-Design Magic

Type what you want ‚Äî "a modern login page," "a pricing section with three plans," or "a mobile navbar" ‚Äî and watch the plugin instantly generate a tailored UI layout in Figma.


2.Fully Editable Components

Every design is natively built in Figma using auto layout, proper naming, and editable styles, so you can customize it immediately without breaking the structure.


3.Style-Aware Generation

Add your own design tokens or themes and the AI will follow your brand colors, fonts, and spacing ‚Äî ensuring consistency across your designs.


4.Smart Iteration

Need a variation? Just refine your prompt or click ‚ÄúRegenerate‚Äù to explore alternative versions instantly, helping you ideate faster and more creatively.


5. Drag-and-Drop Optimization: Enhance AI-generated designs with intuitive drag-and-drop functionality. Refine layouts, edit elements directly within Figma, and tailor the design to your exact needs without the learning curve.


6. Advanced Palette and Theme Capabilities: Codia AI doesn't just design; it stylizes. With advanced palette and theme options, create a personalized design system that resonates with your brand identity and aesthetic preferences.


How It Works:

- Prompt: Begin with your prompt, capturing the essence of your desired outcome, no matter the complexity.

- Create: Codia AI processes your prompt using state-of-the-art AI, translating it into professional wireframes enriched with relevant content.

- Optimize: Refine your design with ease. Swap blocks, drag-and-drop elements, and edit to perfection, all within the familiar environment of Figma.


Elevate your design workflow with Codia AI DesignGen and transform your design ideation into stunning, responsive UIs effortlessly. Welcome to the new era of design with Codia AI.

plugins.name: Pattern Fill
plugins.description:
Pattern Fill


The fastest way to create and use pattern. This plugin helps you to make a pattern with a frame, and fill in another layer as an image paint with tile scale mode.


Working with Figma and Figjam. It's really interesting

to use this plugin in Figjam, as Figjam itself does not support filling pattern, but you can do it with this plugin.


---------------------------------------------------------


How to use

  1. Design your pattern in a frame
  2. Create a layer you want to fill with pattern
  3. Select the pattern layer and the target layer
  4. Run this plugin
  5. Pattern layer will be exported as a 2x image and filled into the target layer with 50% scaling factor

plugins.name: AI Design by Rendition
plugins.description:
Rendition is an AI assistant that helps create beautiful designs.


With Rendition, you can create an app design with AI and get the tailwind code for that design.

 

Join the Rendition discord community for questions: https://discord.com/invite/ZpaYuRTHkt

 

What does this cost to use?

 

Rendition AI costs $10/month

 


To manage trial or cancel subscription: 

 

Open the Rendition plugin in a Figma file, click the "Account" Icon, and in the web browser click on your profile picture and then select "Profile". Or, you can send an email to rob@tryrendition.com.

 

We want you to get the most out of Rendition. Rendition is still in beta, so we are open to any feedback and we continue to improve! Feel free to reach out to us on our Discord: https://discord.com/invite/ZpaYuRTHkt

 

Powered by OpenAI, gpt-4, and gpt-vision.

We‚Äôre here for you!

 

- Team Rendition




Rendition is an AI-powered App generator, useful for UI development. As a free beta software for designers, Rendition uses OpenAI and GPT-Vision, offering an automated UI development tool that simplifies the Figma to React conversion. Rendition is a software development AI assistant, enabling a seamless design to code transition and opening new possibilities in automated design workflows.

plugins.name: JSON to Figma
plugins.description:
An easy way to use real data in Figma.

The plugin can parse local or JSON files from a URL link. You can populate any layers with text or images.


üí° Features:

  • Load local files and fetch from URL
  • Fetch images
  • Supported formats JPG, PNG, WEBP, SVG, GIF
  • Parsing JSON files with any amount of nested levels
  • Flexible keys selection
  • Populate in random order
  • Select any ranges from JSON file
  • Ability to skip layers
  • Remember user settings and JSON using clientStorage
  • Custom URL for your own proxy


üìö Documentation:

https://pavellaptev.notion.site/JSON-to-Figma-e4f79e250b54413ba5797c1d4a806070


üé• Video Tutorial:

https://youtube.com/watch?v=OO2yeeNuj7A&si=EnSIkaIECMiOmarE


ü§ô Feedback:

Please if you have any troubles with the plugin or ideas how I could improve the plugin.
